results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whisky.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: I never did anything worth doing by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.

results.author: Thomas Edison
results.content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

results.author: Charles Dickens
results.content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
